intro: Brachystelma arachnoideum, commonly known as the spider-like stone orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are succulent, adapted to store water, and its flowers are usually pale green or yellow with a distinctive, hairy appearance. Brachystelma arachnoideum is a perennial herb that is often found in rocky outcrops and is popular among succulent collectors.
